question_text: What does POST stand for and what is its primary function during computer startup?
answer_options: Process Operating System Tasks - manages system processes
Power-On Self-Test - diagnostic tests of core hardware components
Program Operational Status Test - checks software functionality
Primary Operating System Troubleshoot - fixes boot problems
correct_answer: Power-On Self-Test - diagnostic tests of core hardware components
explanation: POST stands for Power-On Self-Test. It is a series of diagnostic tests that run automatically when you turn on your computer to check if core components (CPU, memory, video subsystem) are installed and operational before the operating system loads.
